snippet: The departure of James Gooch, who became RadioShack’s chief executive in May 2011, follows an unexpected $21 million loss in the electronics retailer’s latest quarter.
abstract: RadioShack says its chief executive James F Gooch is stepping down immediately under agreement with company's board, in the latest turmoil at the struggling electronics retailer.

snippet: David Pogue looks at the Apple Maps app for iPhone and iPad and is horrified by the mistakes.
abstract: David Pogue looks at the Apple Maps app for iPhone and iPad and is horrified by the mistakes.

headline.main: Pogue: ‘Maps Most Embarrassing, Least Usable Apple Software’

snippet: Apple has replaced Google’s maps with its own, built from scratch, but in the new app entire locations have been mislabeled or erased. We try to track down the problems.
abstract: David Pogue State of the Art column on Apple's replacement of Google’s maps with its own, inferior mapping system, built from scratch; notes in new iPhone app entire locations have been mislabeled or erased; contends making the app reliable and complete will take a very long time.

headline.main: A Map App, as Sleek as iPhone 5, Is Often Off
headline.print_headline: A Map App, As Sleek As iPhone 5, Is Often Off

snippet: Is algebra necessary? An Op-Ed essay argues it isn't. We list algebraic opportunities you can find in the pages of The Times, and invite you to join the conversation.
abstract: Is algebra necessary? An Op-Ed essay argues it isn't. We list algebraic opportunities you can find in the pages of The Times, and invite you to join the conversation.

headline.main: N Ways to Apply Algebra With The New York Times

snippet: In a moves meant to expand its digital offerings, the company on Tuesday introduced two new color tablets and said a video store for its Nook products would make its debut this fall.

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Tablets Aim for Niche Below iPad
headline.print_headline: Barnes & Noble Tablets Aim for Niche Below iPad

snippet: With the revelation that Richard J. Lipsky, convicted of bribery, was assisting federal authorities, officials in Albany and New York City wondered what new scandal might emerge.
abstract: Revelations that lobbyist Richard J Lipsky, convicted of bribing former New York State Senator Carl Kruger, is cooperating with federal authorities suggest that other elected officials could soon find themselves in trouble with the law; at City Hall and in the Capitol, officials appear resigned to the thought that new scandals will emerge.

headline.main: Anticipating Fallout From Lobbyist’s Legal Cooperation
headline.print_headline: Anticipating Fallout From Lobbyist’s Legal Cooperation

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and DAVID W. CHEN

snippet: Charles Plosser, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, said the Fed’s effort to support the economy probably would fall short of its goals.
abstract: Stocks suffer their biggest decline in three months after Charles I Plosser, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, says he doubts the central bank's effort to bolster economic growth will succeed.

headline.main: Major Indexes Dive After Fed Official Voices Doubt About Stimulus
headline.print_headline: Major Indexes Dive After Fed Official Voices Doubt About Stimulus

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
